comment._content: Here's a photo of engine 23 from that same railway: polishrail.wordpress.com/2008/07/15/beyer-peacocks-still-...

comment.author: 93849157@N00
comment._content:
This is Kingsbury and Neasden station -  now Neasden on the Jubilee line - see the later station photo in this set. The station building over the tracks  survived until the 1970s - I remember it well.

No. 67 was the first of the 'C' class locomotives, built in 1891 and withdrawn by 1919, according to p. 23 of "Metropolitan Steam" by EJS Gadsden

comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Metropolitan Railway Metropolitan Line, and we'd love to have this added to the group!
